page.title: 10Roger Harding's Visit
page.content: Roger Harding works for Education Department of Braunton Nature Conservation. He did organise men to repair the dry stone walls, stiles and linhays but now gives nature talks to schools. He is very concerned about {sand erosion}and a great deal of his spare time is taken up planting new stretches of marram grass which binds the sand together. On our first trip to the{Marshes}Mr Harding showed us the course of the{ River Caen which was diverted when{ {Horsey Ridge}was being built. The old river is clearly marked by rushes and reeds.It costs 25 pence toll to go as far as{Crow Point }car park.From there we walked on the boardwalk towards the {Estuary.}
